DataElement.preferredName: Nodal Target Lesion Less Than Ten Millimeter Short Dimension Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to indicator whether a node as a target lesion is less than 10 millimeters (a metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nodal Target Lesion Less Than Ten Millimeter Short Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a node as a target lesion being less than 10 millimeters (a metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.:The goal intended to be attained.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.
An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredName: Less Than Ten Millimeter Short Dimension
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.:A unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter. (NCI):A variable that is stored as a signed 16-bit (2-byte) integer.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
A variable that is stored as a signed 16-bit (2-byte) integer.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Check this box if node reaches sub-clinical level (<10 mm)
